name: White-fronted Lemur
description: A white head is a distinctive trait of males, while females have a gray-brown head. This difference between sexes is noticeable even in weeks-old young.
image_alt: White-fronted Lemur, photo: Prague Zoo Archive
proportions: Body length 24–50 cm; tail 22–64 cm; weight 0.5–3.5 kg
attractions: It is a distinctly arboreal lemur species, rarely descending to the ground. It lives in loosely organized groups of 4–17 individuals, without a pronounced hierarchy.
